pr_title: Issue #11237: Support HTTPS URIs in acmeCA-2.0

timeline.bodyText:
Change "the underlying JRE's Java Secure Socket Extension (JSSE) provider" to "the Java Secure Socket Extension (JSSE) provider of the underlying JRE".
Change "When using the IBM JRE" to "When the IBM JRE is used,"
Change "when using the Oracle JRE" to "when the Oracle JRE is used"
timeline.author: Rwalls1
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -63,3 +63,18 @@ accountKeyFile.desc=A path to the file containing a key identifier for a registe
 
 domainKeyFile=Domain key file
 domainKeyFile.desc=A path to the file containing a key identifier for a domain. If the file does not exist, a new key is generated and written to this file. Back this file up to maintain control of the domain. 
+
+acmeTransportConfig=ACME transport configuration
+acmeTransportConfig.desc=ACME transport layer configuration.
+
+sslProtocol=SSL protocol
+sslProtocol.desc=The SSL handshake protocol. Protocol values can be found in the documentation for the underlying JRE's Java Secure Socket Extension (JSSE) provider.  When using the IBM JRE the default value is SSL_TLSv2 and when using the Oracle JRE the default value is SSL.

timeline.bodyText: Change "The password used to load the truststore file" to "The password that is used to load the truststore file".
timeline.author: Rwalls1
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -63,3 +63,18 @@ accountKeyFile.desc=A path to the file containing a key identifier for a registe
 
 domainKeyFile=Domain key file
 domainKeyFile.desc=A path to the file containing a key identifier for a domain. If the file does not exist, a new key is generated and written to this file. Back this file up to maintain control of the domain. 
+
+acmeTransportConfig=ACME transport configuration
+acmeTransportConfig.desc=ACME transport layer configuration.
+
+sslProtocol=SSL protocol
+sslProtocol.desc=The SSL handshake protocol. Protocol values can be found in the documentation for the underlying JRE's Java Secure Socket Extension (JSSE) provider.  When using the IBM JRE the default value is SSL_TLSv2 and when using the Oracle JRE the default value is SSL.
+
+trustStore=Truststore
+trustStore.desc=A keystore containing trusted certificate entries used by SSL for signing verification.
+
+trustStorePassword=Truststore password
+trustStorePassword.desc=The password used to load the truststore file. The value can be stored in clear text or encoded form. Use the securityUtility tool to encode the password.

timeline.bodyText: Change "A keystore containing trusted certificate entries used by SSL" to A keystore that contains trusted certificate entries that are used by SSL"
timeline.author: Rwalls1
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -63,3 +63,18 @@ accountKeyFile.desc=A path to the file containing a key identifier for a registe
 
 domainKeyFile=Domain key file
 domainKeyFile.desc=A path to the file containing a key identifier for a domain. If the file does not exist, a new key is generated and written to this file. Back this file up to maintain control of the domain. 
+
+acmeTransportConfig=ACME transport configuration
+acmeTransportConfig.desc=ACME transport layer configuration.
+
+sslProtocol=SSL protocol
+sslProtocol.desc=The SSL handshake protocol. Protocol values can be found in the documentation for the underlying JRE's Java Secure Socket Extension (JSSE) provider.  When using the IBM JRE the default value is SSL_TLSv2 and when using the Oracle JRE the default value is SSL.
+
+trustStore=Truststore
+trustStore.desc=A keystore containing trusted certificate entries used by SSL for signing verification.

timeline.message: Issue #11237: Support HTTPS URIs in acmeCA-2.0
Issue #11237: Support HTTPS URIs in acmeCA-2.0
